intro: Hieracium villosum var. glabrescens, commonly known as the soft-haired hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–50 cm, with hairy stems that become smoother as the plant matures. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in clusters, blooming from June to September. It thrives in disturbed soils and open habitats, often found in meadows and along roadsides.
